item.title: The more specific the mobile advertisement, the higher its earnings
item.description:
Smaato, a mobile advertising company, has observed that the most successful advertising categories in China during the first quarter of the year were shopping, e-commerce, communication, and technology. These categories achieved high eCPMs (effective cost per mille), reaching up to US$0.30. When analyzing mobile real-time bidding (RTB) ad expenditures in China during the same period, entertainment (30%) and games (22%) were the top two categories. Ajitpal Pannu, Smaato’s Chief Strategy Officer, noted that both monetization and brand spending increased when essential parameters were shared globally with advertising partners...

item.title: I Know Where You Took Your Pictures Last Summer
item.description:
Eye-Fi, the WiFi-enabled memory card, has introduced a new feature: location tagging. Their latest product, Eye-Fi Explore, automatically adds geotags to photos as you take them. You might be surprised to learn that they haven’t actually included a GPS receiver in the small SD card. Instead, it uses a system that determines location based on known WiFi hotspots. This method covers a significant portion of the U.S. population and major metropolitan areas in Europe...

item.title: Makani numbers in Dubai assist taxi drivers in locating their customers
item.description:
Source: RTA. Dubai taxis are now connected to the city through the Makani system. Dubai’s Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) Public Transport Agency has successfully connected 4,500 taxis operated by franchise companies to the Dubai Municipality’s Makani System. This system utilizes unique coordinates, known as Makani numbers, for precise building location.
